body_html: @cpuhrsch I find some info which are maybe useful. However, oversubscription is possible because TBB and OpenMP run-time libraries create separate thread pools, by default each creates a number of threads that matches the number of cores. You can acquire more info in this post.
body_text: @cpuhrsch I find some info which are maybe useful.  However, oversubscription is possible because TBB and OpenMP run-time libraries create separate thread pools, by default each creates a number of threads that matches the number of cores. You can acquire more info in this post.
body: @cpuhrsch I find some info which are maybe useful.  [However, oversubscription is possible because TBB and OpenMP run-time libraries create separate thread pools, by default each creates a number of threads that matches the number of cores](https://software.intel.com/en-us/intel-threading-building-blocks-openmp-or-native-threads). You can acquire more info in this post.
